description: This table contains high-level information on the episodes recorded in the clinical system for your patients. When a provider sees a patient several times for an ongoing condition, such as prenatal care, these encounters can be linked to a single Episode of Care. It does not contain episodes linked to an inpatient encounter.

columns.name: EPISODE_ID
columns.description: The unique ID of the episode of care record.

columns.name: NAME
columns.description: The name of the episode.

columns.name: SUM_BLK_TYPE_ID
columns.description: The episode type.

columns.name: START_DATE
columns.description: The date the episode was initiated.

columns.name: END_DATE
columns.description: The date the episode was resolved in calendar format. This field is called "Resolved" on the clinical system screen.

columns.name: COMMENTS
columns.description: Any free text comments about the episode.

columns.name: PREGRAVID_WEIGHT
columns.description: This field contains the pre-pregnancy weight maintained before this episode.

columns.name: NUMBER_OF_BABIES
columns.description: Prior to delivery, this column is expected to contain the number of fetuses that the patient is carrying. This can be manually documented, such as in the Prenatal Vitals section, or the value can be automatically set by creating or removing fetal result tabs in the ultrasound activity.  If your organization documents on the Delivery Summary then after the Delivery Summary is signed, this column is expected to contain the number of viable deliveries associated with the pregnancy. Specifically, this is the number of delivery records attached to the pregnancy. This expectation is based on Epic's recommendation that only viable deliveries should be documented on the Delivery Summary. Your organization may follow a different policy for when to create a delivery record. The behavior of this column containing the number of delivery records may be overridden at the profile level in system definitions, in which case it will continue to contain the number of fetuses that were being carried unless the number of deliveries is manually documented in its place.

columns.name: PRIMARY_LPL_ID
columns.description: The primary problem linked to the episode.

columns.name: STATUS_C_NAME
columns.description:
The status category number for the episode.


May contain organization-specific values: No


 Category Entries: 


Active


Resolved


Deleted

columns.name: L_UPDATE_USER_ID
columns.description: The ID of the last user that updated the episode of care record.

columns.name: PATERNITY_ACK_C_NAME
columns.description:
Whether a paternity acknowledgement has been signed by the father of the baby if the parents are not married.


May contain organization-specific values: Yes


 Category Entries: 


Yes


No


Unknown


Unnecessary

columns.name: SMOKE_3_MO_BEF
columns.description: The number of cigarettes/packs smoked per day 3 months before the pregnancy by the mother.

columns.name: SMOKE_3_MO_BEF_C_NAME
columns.description:
The unit of measurement for the quantity of cigarettes being smoked 3 months before the pregnancy by the mother.


May contain organization-specific values: Yes


 Category Entries: 


Packs


Cigarettes

columns.name: SMOKE_1ST_3_MO
columns.description: The number of cigarettes/packs smoked per day in the first 3 months of the pregnancy by the mother.

columns.name: SMOKE_1ST_3_MO_C_NAME
columns.description:
The unit of measurement for the quantity of cigarettes being smoked the first three months of the pregnancy by the mother.


 The category values for this column were already listed for column: SMOKE_3_MO_BEF_C_NAME

columns.name: SMOKE_2ND_3_MO
columns.description: The number of cigarettes/packs smoked per day in the second 3 months of the pregnancy by the mother.

columns.name: SMOKE_2ND_3_MO_C_NAME
columns.description:
The unit of measurement for the quantity of cigarettes being smoked the second three months of the pregnancy by the mother.


 The category values for this column were already listed for column: SMOKE_3_MO_BEF_C_NAME

columns.name: SMOKE_3RD_TRI
columns.description: The number of cigarettes/packs smoked per day in the third trimester of the pregnancy by the mother.

columns.name: SMOKE_3RD_TRI_C_NAME
columns.description:
The unit of measurement for the quantity of cigarettes being smoked the third trimester of the pregnancy by the mother.


 The category values for this column were already listed for column: SMOKE_3_MO_BEF_C_NAME

columns.name: DRINK_3_MO_BEF
columns.description: The number of alcoholic drinks consumed per week 3 months before the pregnancy by the mother.

columns.name: DRINK_1ST_3_MO
columns.description: The number of alcoholic drinks consumed per week in the first three months of the pregnancy by the mother.

columns.name: DRINK_2ND_3_MO
columns.description: The number of alcoholic drinks consumed per week in the second three months of the pregnancy by the mother.

columns.name: DRINK_3RD_TRI
columns.description: The number of alcoholic drinks consumed per week in the third trimester of the pregnancy by the mother.

columns.name: IN_CITY_LIMITS_YN
columns.description:
Whether the address of the mother is inside the city limits.


May contain organization-specific values: No


 Category Entries: 


No


Yes

columns.name: WIC_FOODS_YN
columns.description:
Did the mother receive WIC foods during this pregnancy?


 The category values for this column were already listed for column: IN_CITY_LIMITS_YN

columns.name: TOTAL_PNC
columns.description: Override value to be used in situations where not all prenatal care was given at the same Epic provider and so not all prenatal care visits are in the system.

columns.name: MONTH_1ST_PNC
columns.description: Override value to be used in situations where not all prenatal care was given at the same Epic provider and so first date of prenatal care is not in the system and the month of the pregnancy when prenatal care began cannot be calculated.

columns.name: LIVE_BIRTHS_LIVING
columns.description: Override value to be used in situations where not all prenatal care was given at the same Epic provider, and consequently, other pregnancy information is not available. The number of children born alive which are still living not including children born at this birth.

columns.name: LIVE_BIRTHS_DEAD
columns.description: Override value to be used in situations where not all prenatal care was given at the same Epic provider, and consequently, other pregnancy information is not available. The number of other children born alive which are now deceased not including any born alive and deceased at this birth.

columns.name: MOTHER_MARRIED_YN
columns.description:
Whether the mother is married at birth, conception, or any time in between.


 The category values for this column were already listed for column: IN_CITY_LIMITS_YN

columns.name: OB_PREGRAVID_BMI
columns.description: The patient's pre-pregnancy BMI for this pregnancy episode.

columns.name: FIRST_PNT_LOC_C_NAME
columns.description:
This item stores who the patient's first prenatal care was with.


May contain organization-specific values: Yes

columns.name: SERV_AREA_ID
columns.description: The unique ID of the episode's service area. This column is used for DBC episodes, which are specific to a service area.

columns.name: OB_WRK_EDD_DT
columns.description: The estimated date of delivery for a pregnancy episode.

columns.name: EXPECTED_DEL_LOC_C_NAME
columns.description:
Location where the woman plans to deliver her baby.


May contain organization-specific values: Yes

columns.name: DEL_LOC_CHANGE_C_NAME
columns.description:
Why the delivery location changed from the expected delivery location (EXPECTED_DEL_LOC_C) for a pregnancy episode.


May contain organization-specific values: Yes

columns.name: OB_FEEDING_INTENTIONS_C_NAME
columns.description:
Mother's intended feeding method for the baby.


May contain organization-specific values: Yes


 Category Entries: 


Breast Milk


Formula


Breast Milk and Formula

columns.name: INTENT_TREAT_C_NAME
columns.description:
The intended treatment for an implanted Mechanical Circulatory Device.


May contain organization-specific values: Yes


 Category Entries: 


Medical Management


Bridge to Recovery


Rescue Therapy


Bridge to Transplant - Currently Listed


Possible Bridge to Transplant - Likely Eligible


Possible Bridge to Transplant - Moderate Likelihood


Possible Bridge to Transplant - Unlikely Eligible


Destination Therapy - Modifiable


Destination Therapy - Unmodifiable


Unknown


Other

columns.name: INTENT_TREAT_OTHR
columns.description: The free text intended treatment for an implanted Mechanical Circulatory Device.

columns.name: MCS_DISCHARGE_DT
columns.description: Date a Mechanical Circulatory Device patient is discharged.

columns.name: MCS_EVAL_DT
columns.description: The start date of the Mechanical Circulatory Device evaluation.

columns.name: MCS_REV_DT
columns.description: The date when the Mechanical Circulatory Device case was reviewed by the evaluation committee.

columns.name: MCS_ADMISSION_DT
columns.description: Date of the admission for the Mechanical Circulatory Device procedure.

columns.name: MCS_SURG_DT
columns.description: The date of the Mechanical Circulatory Device surgery.

columns.name: MCS_IS_HISTORIC_YN
columns.description:
Flag indicating a historic Mechanical Circulatory Device episode. This is intended to flag if the Device was implanted at another center than the Center that is currently following the patient.


May contain organization-specific values: No


 Category Entries: 


Yes


No

columns.name: MCS_EVAL_END_DT
columns.description: The date on which the Mechanical Circulatory Device evaluation was completed.

columns.name: MCS_NEXT_REVIEW_DT
columns.description: The date on which both the Mechanical Circulatory Device episode and the patient chart should be reviewed.

columns.name: MCS_REFERRAL_DT
columns.description: The date the patient was referred for the Mechanical Circulatory Device.

columns.name: MCS_TXPORT_MTHD_C_NAME
columns.description:
The method of transportation to the implantation center.


May contain organization-specific values: Yes


 Category Entries: 


Car


Ambulance


Airplane


Helicopter
